results.title: Using visuals in your speech
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Text-Films and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”
Shows how to use various kinds of visual methods and devices when giving a talk, illustrating the manner in which the speech is made more interesting and effective.

results.title: Stage fright and what to do
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
Analyzes the causes of stage fright and shows how an inexperienced public speaker can overcome it in the following ways: Realise that someone in the audience is interested your experiences; prepare the speech, using examples, stories, reasons and conclusions; practise the presentation of the speech; speak directly to friendly members of the audience; ignore small mistakes; concentrate on what is to be said, not on how it is presented.

results.title: Conducting a meeting
results.creator_credit: Centron Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speech”.
A group of adults, all talking at once, are involved in a discussion. Suddenly a voice calls the group to order and advises them on the correct way to hold a meeting. Parliamentary rules of procedure and the order of business are demonstrated from the first call to order to the final adjournment. Review of important features of meeting at end.

results.title: Eat to live
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Food has alway’s been man’s first preoccupation. Today, while many people get too little of the foods necessary for good health, others of us are overweight through eating too much food that has little or no nutritional value

results.title: Say English cheese
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Cheese making today is an industry, but still a craft. And English cheeses are now better value than ever, in price and nutritional value. From the series “Review No 10 - 27th year (635)”.

results.title: Full cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
With the present shortage of fuel in Britain, the bicycle has come into its own as a humane machine, efficient, and adaptable alike for work or pleasure. This general film on cycling shows the manufacture of bicycles, bicycle competitions, riding and safety.

results.title: Frozen music
results.brief_description: This film is an examination of the thoughts and aspirations of the Victorian ruling class mentality as revealed through the Albert Memorial, a monument of pure signification. The soundtrack, composed by Michael Nyman, consists of a montage of voices, and is composed of Victorian quotations and modern analyses, together with the bemused speculation of a couple of American tourists.

results.title: Gandhi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces Gandhi’s rise to power in India and his struggles to win independence for his country, terminating in his assassination on January 30, 1948. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Victory over polio
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
The history of polio and its treatment and the discovery of the Salk vaccine. Old newsreels show the late President Roosevelt in the early stages of treatment at the Georgia Retreat, and Sister Kenny at work. Some of the medical men who have worked on the disease and the final triumph by Dr. Jonas E. Salk.
